text:
93-73 Varick Street, west side, from Watts to Canal Streets, the block which is to be demolished early in 1929, showing also 431 Canal Street, at the N.W. corner of Varick Street. No. 93, on the corner at the right, and No. 89, are frame houses with a brick facing. No. 431 Canal Street has no Varick Street house number. June, 1925.

Brown Brothers.

Varick Street, east side, from Watts to Grand Streets, showing the C. W. H. Carter Building.
September 27, 1927.

P. L. Sperr.

Holland Tunnel Plaza, Watts Street, north side, between Varick and Hudson Streets, approximately at the site of 88-94 Watts Street. A bus is turning into the entrance for west-bound traffic, between 576 and 584 Broome Street (q.v.)
September 7, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.

(1)
Watts Street, south side, from No. 99, east of Hudson Street, to No. 51, east of Varick, inclusive. Nos. 99 to 75, the group of old houses west of, adjoining and at Varick Street, S.W. corner, are shortly to be demolished for the site of the Holland Plaza Building. A number of these old houses are brick faced frame houses, specifically Nos. 91-89, 83, 81, 79, and 75 at the corner. The last is faced with brick on the 93 Varick Street side.
October 11, 1928.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, seen from Hudson Street, four months later, when the entire block has been cleared off except for a few trees. The large white building is on the east side of Varick Street (q.v.) from Watts Street to Grand.
February 25, 1929.

P. L. Sperr.

(1)
Watts Street, south side, from No. 99, east of Hudson Street, to No. 51, east of Varick, inclusive. Nos. 99 to 75, the group of old houses west of, adjoining and at Varick Street, S.W. corner, are shortly to be demolished for the site of the Holland Plaza Building. A number of these old houses are brick faced frame houses, specifically Nos. 91-89, 83, 81, 79, and 75 at the corner. The last is faced with brick on the 93 Varick Street side.
October 11, 1928.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, seen from Hudson Street, four months later, when the entire block has been cleared off except for a few trees. The large white building is on the east side of Varick Street (q.v.) from Watts Street to Grand.
February 25, 1929.

P. L. Sperr.

Varick Street, west side, from Watts to Canal Streets, inclusive, showing the clearing for the Holland Plaza Building about to be erected on the site, and the buildings on the south side of Canal Street, seen across the clearing.

March 8, 1929.

P. L. Sperr.

Holland Tunnel Entrance Plaza, Watts Street, between Varick and Hudson Streets, view west. The buildings on the south side of Watts Street have been demolished to make room for the new Holland Plaza Building.

February 12, 1929.

P. L. Sperr.

Varick Street, north from, but not including, Watts Street. The first factory on the east side north of the Spring Street Church, whose side and rear is shown, is the Stanley & Patterson Building (about 1928), occupying the block from Spring to Vandam Streets.
March 20, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

Holland Tunnel Plaza (westbound traffic), Watts Street, north side, from Hudson Street to Varick Street, inclusive.
June 3, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(1)
60, 58, 56 Watts Street, north side, east of and from Varick Street. The steps of No. 62 are shown at the extreme left. 1912.

Gift of Samuel Landsman.

(2)
Watts Street, North Side and Westwards to Varick Street.

July 25th, 1939

P.L. Sperr,

(1)
60, 58, 56 Watts Street, north side, east of and from Varick Street. The steps of No. 62 are shown at the extreme left. 1912.

Gift of Samuel Landsman.

(2)
Watts Street, North Side and Westwards to Varick Street.

July 25th, 1939

P.L. Sperr,

Watts Street, east side, adjoining the southeast corner of Varick Street at No. 163-167, looking north. Note No. 63-67 indicating change.

P. L. Sperr
April 30, 1940
